page.title: 18THE VILLAGE OF BORDEN
page.content: Borden is a small village,south of the A2,about 1\ miles from Sittingbourne. It is generally a very quiet place to live but at peak times people use Borden as a short cut to and from the motorway.Borden has a sub post-office but no bank;a general store,a craft shop,a pub and at Oad Street,a blacksmith.The houses are 'up-market'. Some very modern,others very old.There are farm workers cottages and a small council estate called'Mountview'.Some people say it is the best of both worlds because it has the benefit of the country-side with easy access to Sittingbourne town centre.There is a community atmosphere and about 100 people attend each church service with an average of 30 weddings a year.Even in this haven glimpses of vandalism can be seen in the children's playground.
